column4: hi, how can i mount a ntfs partition in linux and get user rights for it so i can share it with write access
are you wanting it to mount on boot?

mount it, i have installed ntfs-3g already and i can mount the partition, but its always mounted with root access rights and if i right click and choose share, then i get a message saying that i dont own the folder
you don't need ntfs-3g in ubuntu, or really any recent kernel.   try:     chown -R USER:GROUP /mount/point
